org.mitre.mat.core
Class AnnotationCore

java.lang.Object
  org.mitre.mat.core.AnnotationCore
Direct Known Subclasses:
Annotation, SpanlessAnnotation
public abstract class AnnotationCore
extends java.lang.Object

The core Annotation class for MAT.

AnnotationCore

protected AnnotationCore(MATDocument doc,
                         Atype parent,
                         int start,
                         int end,
                         java.util.List valsList)
                  throws AnnotationException
Constructor for a spanned annotation -- should only be called from the corresponding Annotation constructor and not directly. This is here because Annotation needs to have a superclass constructor that can set start and end for it before the default values are initialized.

Parameters:
doc -
parent -
start -
end -
valsList -
Throws:
AnnotationException

setAttributeValue

public void setAttributeValue(java.lang.String attr,
                              AttributeValueSet value)
                       throws AnnotationException,
                              MATDocumentException
Sets a Set-valued attribute value. It is preferable to use the version that also takes an attribute type parameter unless the attribute type is "string". If you don't pass in an attrtype, first we will try to find the existing AttributeType for attr; if there isn't one, we will try to infer the attrtype from the AttributeValueSet, but that will only work if the AttributeValueSet has ofAttribute already set, which is unlikely so usually we will just have to assume "string" here -- if it's something else, pass it in.

Parameters:
attr - the String name of the attribute whose value is to be set
value - the value to set the attribute to
Throws:
MATDocumentException
AnnotationException
See Also:
setAttributeValue(String,String,AttributeValueSet)

setAttributeValue

public void setAttributeValue(java.lang.String attr,
                              java.lang.String attrtype,
                              AttributeValueSet value)
                       throws AnnotationException,
                              MATDocumentException
Sets a Set-valued attribute value.

Parameters:
attr - the String name of the attribute whose value is to be set
attrtype - the type of the attribute which must be one of the types defined in the Atype class
value - the value to set the attribute to
Throws:
AnnotationException
MATDocumentException
See Also:
Atype.STRING_ATTR_TYPE, Atype.INT_ATTR_TYPE, Atype.FLOAT_ATTR_TYPE, Atype.BOOLEAN_ATTR_TYPE, Atype.ANNOTATION_ATTR_TYPE, Atype.ATTR_TYPES

setAttributeValue

public void setAttributeValue(java.lang.String attr,
                              AttributeValueList value)
                       throws AnnotationException,
                              MATDocumentException
Sets a List-valued attribute value. It is preferable to use the version that also takes an attribute type parameter unless the attribute type is "string". If you don't pass in an attrtype, first we will try to find the existing AttributeType for attr; if there isn't one, we will try to infer the attrtype from the AttributeValueList, but that will only work if the AttributeValueSet has ofAttribute already set, which is unlikely so usually we will just have to assume "string" here -- if it's something else, pass it in.

Parameters:
attr - the String name of the attribute whose value is to be set
value - the value to set the attribute to
Throws:
MATDocumentException
AnnotationException
See Also:
setAttributeValue(String,String,AttributeValueList)

                              AttributeValueList value)
                       throws AnnotationException,
                              MATDocumentException
Sets a List-valued attribute value.

Parameters:

attrtype - the type of the attribute which must be one of the types defined in the Atype class
value - the value to set the attribute to

setAttributeValue

public void setAttributeValue(int index,
                              java.lang.String value)
                       throws MATDocumentException,
                              AnnotationException
A variant of setAttributeValue meant to be used ONLY with the JSON decoder. This method must convert the String value read from the JSON to the type required for the annotation at the given index.

Parameters:
index -
value -
Throws:
MATDocumentException
AnnotationException
